title: SSC CGL 2025 Notification - Combined Graduate Level Examination
description: Staff Selection Commission invites applications for Combined Graduate Level Examination 2025. Eligible candidates can apply for various Group B and C posts in central government ministries and departments.
overview: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has released the official notification for the Combined Graduate Level (CGL) Examination 2025. This annual recruitment drive offers opportunities for graduate candidates seeking prestigious Group B and Group C positions across central government ministries, departments, and organizations. The SSC CGL 2025 examination remains one of India's most competitive government recruitment processes, attracting lakhs of aspirants nationwide. Successful candidates gain access to rewarding careers with excellent job security, competitive pay scales under the 7th Pay Commission, and comprehensive benefits including pension, medical facilities, and housing allowances. The examination structure includes multiple tiers designed to assess candidates' aptitude, reasoning abilities, quantitative skills, and domain knowledge. Candidates are advised to begin preparation early and refer exclusively to official sources for accurate information regarding the SSC CGL 2025 recruitment process.

applicationFee.note: Fee payment can be made through online modes including net banking, credit card, debit card, and UPI. No offline payment accepted.

ageLimit: Minimum Age: 18 years as on the specified cut-off date
Maximum Age: 27-32 years depending on the post applied
Age Relaxation for PwD: 10 years (additional relaxation for SC/ST/OBC PwD candidates)
vacancyDetails: The SSC CGL 2025 recruitment is expected to fill approximately 15,000-20,000 vacancies across various departments. Category-wise and post-wise vacancy breakup will be notified in the official notification. Major recruiting ministries include Ministry of Finance, Ministry of External Affairs, Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT), Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC), and various attached and subordinate offices.
eligibility: Educational Qualification: Bachelor's Degree in any discipline from a recognized University or equivalent
Nationality: Must be a citizen of India (certain posts have specific nationality requirements)
Physical Standards: As per requirements of specific posts (applicable for Inspector posts)
No minimum percentage required in graduation for most posts
selectionProcess: Tier-I: Computer Based Examination (100 questions, 200 marks, 60 minutes)
Tier-II: Computer Based Examination (Paper I mandatory, Papers II & III for specific posts)
Document Verification: Original documents verification at Regional Office
Medical Examination: For posts requiring physical standards
Final Merit List: Based on combined performance in all applicable stages
howToApply: Visit the official SSC website at ssc.nic.in
Navigate to the 'Register' section if you are a new user
Complete One-Time Registration with valid email ID and mobile number
Login to your account and click on 'Apply' under CGL 2025
Fill the application form with accurate personal and educational details
Upload recent passport-size photograph (20-50 KB, JPG format)
Upload scanned signature (10-20 KB, JPG format)
Select examination centers as per your preference
Pay the application fee through online mode
Submit the application and download the confirmation page
posts: Assistant Audit Officer (AAO), Assistant Accounts Officer (AAO), Assistant Section Officer (ASO), Inspector (CBDT/CBIC/CBI/Preventive Officer/Examiner), Sub-Inspector (CBI/NIA), Assistant Enforcement Officer (AEO), Tax Assistant, Upper Division Clerk (UDC), and Junior Statistical Officer (JSO)

faqs.question: What is the educational qualification required for SSC CGL 2025?
faqs.answer: Candidates must possess a Bachelor's Degree in any discipline from a recognized University or equivalent. There is no minimum percentage requirement for most posts.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for SSC CGL 2025 examination?
faqs.answer: The age limit varies by post, ranging from 18-27 years to 18-32 years. Age relaxation is provided for SC/ST (5 years), OBC (3 years), and PwD candidates (10 years) as per government norms.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for SSC CGL 2025?
faqs.answer: The application fee is Rs. 100 for General, OBC, and EWS candidates. Women candidates and candidates belonging to SC, ST, and PwD categories are exempted from paying the fee.

faqs.question: How many attempts are allowed for SSC CGL examination?
faqs.answer: There is no limit on the number of attempts for SSC CGL examination. Candidates can appear as many times as they wish, subject to meeting the age eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for SSC CGL 2025?
faqs.answer: The selection process consists of Tier-I (Computer Based Test), Tier-II (CBT with multiple papers), Document Verification, and Medical Examination for applicable posts. Final selection is based on combined merit.
